Department of Public Safety











How Can DPS Help You?
We are a full-service public safety department that serves the Brown Community 24 hours a day, seven days a week, patrolling the campus to deter crime, develop community relations, and respond to calls for service and assistance.



















How Can DPS Help You?
We are a full-service public safety department that serves the Brown Community 24 hours a day, seven days a week, patrolling the campus to deter crime, develop community relations, and respond to calls for service and assistance.


















For Emergency Police, Fire, Medical Response (24-hour), call (401) 863-4111
For Non-Emergency DPS Response, call (401) 863-3322 or email campus_safety@brown.edu

  Learn More About DPS

















About





  The department’s mission emphasizes crime prevention, problem solving and joint officer-community responsibility.  



Visit Page
















Open details for About



























Alerts





  Crime alerts and advisories to the Brown community 



Visit Page
















Open details for Alerts



























Clery Compliance and Crime Reporting





  The Clery Act is a federal law that requires colleges and universities to disclose certain information about campus crime in a matter that is timely and annual.



Visit Page
















Open details for Clery Compliance and Crime Reporting



























Crime Prevention





  The Crime Prevention Unit seeks to keep the community and DPS fully informed about crime awareness and prevention.



Visit Page
















Open details for Crime Prevention



























Programs & Services





  The Department of Public Safety offers a variety of resources to our community in order to make the campus a safer place to learn, teach, work, and live.
